c74object.name: multiconvolve~
c74object.digest: Multichannel realtime zero- or low- latency convolution
c74object.description: multiconvolve~ is the all-in-one realtime convolution solution of the HIRT

objarg.name: num_ins
objarg.description:
Default = 1
If number of outputs is not specified it will be equal to the number of inputs. This invokes parallel mode, where channels work independently in parallel only (input 1 outputs to output 1 and so on).
Otherwise, the object invokes a matrix of convolvers (one for each input-output combination) that can be set independently.

objarg.name: num_outs
objarg.description:
Default = 1
If number of outputs is not specified it will be equal to the number of inputs. This invokes parallel mode, where channels work independently in parallel only (input 1 outputs to output 1 and so on).
Otherwise, the object invokes a matrix of convolvers (one for each input-output combination) that can be set independently.

objarg.name: latency_mode
objarg.description:
Default = zero
Latency mode may be one of the following:
zero: zero-latency convolution, 0 samples delay, (least efficient)
short: short delay, 128 samples delay, (more efficient)
medium: medium delay, 512 samples delay, (most efficient)

method.name: set
method.description:
Syntax: set [<int: input_channel>] [<int: output_channel>] <symbol: buffer_name> [<int: buffer_channel>]
By default output_channel is equal to input_channel and buffer_channel = 1

method.name: signal
method.digest: Audio signal inlets for realtime convolution
method.description: The number of audio signal inputs for realtime processing is determined by the argument(s) to the object

attribute.name: fixedsize
attribute.description:
Set in integer values. This sets the memory allocation for all convolvers to a fixed size (in samples). When zero (default), memory allocation is dynamic, adapting to the size of the loaded IRs. If the fixed size changes, all IRs are cleared.
This should be used in cases where memory allocation must be tightly controlled, or dynamic memory allocation is not viable.
units: samples, default: 0 (dynamic)

c74object.discussion: multiconvolve~ either functions to allow realtime convolution of multiple parallel mono channels, or as a convolution matrix where each input-output path can have an individual IR set from buffers.
